conclusion: To solve the problem, we need to understand the principles of total internal reflection in optical fibers.
Total internal reflection occurs when the angle of incidence is greater than the critical angle, which is given by the formula: θ_critical = arcsin(1/n).
The refractive index of the fiber material (n) is given as 1.5, and the incident angle (α) is 45°.
The critical angle (θ_critical) is calculated using the formula θ_critical = arcsin(1/n).
Substituting n = 1.5 into the formula, θ_critical = arcsin(1/1.5).
The value of arcsin(1/1.5) is approximately 37.1°, so θ_critical ≈ 37.1°.
The angle of total internal reflection (θ) is calculated as θ = 90° - θ_critical.
Substituting θ_critical ≈ 37.1° into the formula, θ = 90° - 37.1°.
The value of 90° - 37.1° is approximately 52.9°, so θ ≈ 52.9°.
